author: Yantoultra Ngui
title: Malaysia Passes ‘Fake News’ Law That Critics Call an Assault on Speech
text:
KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia—Malaysia is prohibiting “fake news” with a law opponents say will inhibit free speech ahead of national elections.
The upper house of Parliament approved the bill by voice vote Tuesday, a day after it passed the lower house. It makes “maliciously” spreading or creating false news punishable by up to six years in prison. Lower-house amendments had softened the bill somewhat; it had previously set a maximum 10-year term for “knowingly” spreading or creating false news. The maximum fine remained 500,000...
